{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2973285,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2021-10-25T15:27:25.678Z","cooked":"

It had come up that some users were anticipating that RobotPy might be available during the beta period, so it’s worth clearing up what I anticipate the schedule for RobotPy will be this year.

I generally don’t bother with preparing RobotPy for the beta period because lots of things will tend to change during the period. This year has the RoboRio upgrade, but my understanding is that the RoboRio 2 environment is going to be basically the same as the RoboRio 1 environment from a software perspective, so I’m not concerned about compatibility issues in the coming year.

Most years I tend to start performing the RobotPy upgrade process in late November or December. If others want to start on that before me, I’m definitely open to it. I am not personally planning on starting on it earlier at this time due to other commitments.

For those who are wondering, I am currently working on the upgrades for 2022. I expect to have a release by the end of the weekend.

If you’re interested in helping out, stop by gitter and chat!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2022-01-08T09:03:58.994Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":109.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":396795,"topic_slug":"robotpy-2022-schedule","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/robotpy-and-new-rev-control-system/399213/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"RobotPy and New REV Control System","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-2022-schedule/396795/2","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988069,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T08:21:15.468Z","cooked":"

Sorry for the delays, there were some unexpected technical issues with upgrading WPILib this year. I do have it compiled, but it seems to be quirky so I’m not going to do a release now. Hopefully will get it all wrapped up and packaged Monday night.

For those who are super-technical and adventurous* there are a bunch of 2022 branches in various RobotPy repositories – but it all depends on a particular branch of robotpy-build. But, if you can’t figure out how to do it without instructions, you probably should just keep playing with 2021 for another day.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2022-01-10T08:21:15.468Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":65.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":396795,"topic_slug":"robotpy-2022-schedule","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-2022-schedule/396795/3","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988946,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T09:40:49.729Z","cooked":"

Well as they say, there’s good news and bad news.

Good news:

  • The labor-intensive boring part of upgrading all of the libraries and vendors supported by RobotPy (CTRE, NavX, PWF, REV) has been completed, so everything will be ready at mostly the same time this year!
  • There will be pytest support this year! (probably won’t release until this weekend, however)

The Bad news is… that time is not now.

  • Need to investigate weird technical error in simulation
  • Still need to package and upload everything

Tonight, only bad news. I’m just leaving work now, and there’s a client meeting in the morning, so I’ll actually have to go to sleep. No upgrades happening by me tonight.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2022-01-12T04:42:57.538Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":23.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":396795,"topic_slug":"robotpy-2022-schedule","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-2022-schedule/396795/5","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2990582,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T09:19:26.891Z","cooked":"

Tonight a mix of news.

  • Identified why teleopPeriodic wasn’t being called – the wpilib units library support has some issues that need to be addressed
  • Wrote some tests to verify that the behavior will be correct once the issue has been addressed
  • Haven’t addressed the issue yet

If this is the last thing (and I expect it will be), then will be able to push all of the releases out shortly afterwards.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T09:19:26.891Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":61.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":396795,"topic_slug":"robotpy-2022-schedule","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":11063,"username":"virtuald","name":"Dustin Spicuzza","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-2022-schedule/396795/6","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991385,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T08:41:52.363Z","cooked":"

A fix for the units issue is in and I’m able to compile all RobotPy libraries locally, and simulation seems to work. Friday night will be pushing out all the releases.

There’s a lot of documentation updates and examples updates and other things that I’d love some help with!

Unfortunately, we’re having significant issues getting things working correctly on Windows… some RobotPy libraries have been pushed out, but not all of them.

More progress! But, Windows once again getting in the way of builds. Expect to get the last of the packages pushed out on Sunday.
